October 30, 1963
Mr. Biwin T. Cornelius
English language Service
800 18th Street, N.W.
Washington, D.C.
Dear Mr. Cornelius:
We appreciate the opportunity to discuss with you informal 1 y the
possibility of having the English language Service, Inc*, prepare and
arrange for the distribution of materials which we are seeking to
provide as part of a contract between the 8.A.E.B* and the united
States Information Agency*
The purpose of this letter is to outline the work which remains to be
done under this contract as a basis for ascertaining whether the
English language Service is in a position to be of assistance. The
categories of work remaining arei
1. A written prospectus outlining a graded sequence of
language structures to be used in fifteen-minute
broadcast programs from the elementary through the
advanced level. She prospectus should include a
systematic statement of intonation, stress, Juncture,
and pronunciation that may be developed in conjunction
with the sequence of structures and with the fifteen-
minute program units.
2. Sixty-five completed fifteen-minute radio scripts
for a basic English course. This will be based cm
the written prospectus and will enable detailed
statements of the contextual situations to be used
in each of the scripts as well as clear statements
of what is to be learned or accomplished in each of
these programs.
Our time schedule for this work requires the submission of all the
materials by December 31, 19^3, Iwfc ve have assurance from the
contracting officer of the United States Information Agency that we
will have some flexibility here and can probably figure at least two
or three months into 1964 as a more reasonable terminal date for the
materials*
